required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Adaptation in Lower Extremity After 3 Running Days, With a Group Trained by Eccentric Overload
clinical_study.official_title: Differences in Muscle (Vastus Laterals and Gastrocnemius Medialis) and Tendon Adaptation (Patellar and Achilles) in Lower Extremity After 3 Running Days With a Group Trained by Eccentric Overload, Measured by Ultrasound and Thermography

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the changes in muscles and tendons in the lower limb after an intervention of fatigue during 3 consecutive days between trained or not healthy subjects. One of the 2 groups received training by eccentric overload previously.

detailed_description.textblock:
Changes in muscle and tendon tissues, due to exercise, could determine in the future the possibility of an injury. Understand the changes in the mechanical tissues is a key tool for prevention.
The evaluation of the thickness and area in tendons, the existence of new vessels within the tendon, muscle pennation angle or thermography are tools that have been widely used to detect these changes.
Running is one of the activities that can cause more muscle-tendon injuries, specially overuse injuries. However, the eccentric exercise suggest to make some adaptations in different tissues that may be beneficial to prevent damage after exercise.

primary_outcome.measure: Composite Measure with Ultrasound in Tendons and Muscles
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline in tendon structure, an expected average of 3 days of running
primary_outcome.description: Ultrasound in Patellar and Achilles Tendon, to measure area, thickness and new blood vessels with Doppler. Ultrasound in Vastus Lateralis and Gastrocnemius Medialis to measure pennation angle

secondary_outcome.measure: Temperature changes in Patellar and Achilles Tendon as assessed by thermography
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline in tendon structure after 3 days of running. Just immediately and 10 minutes after intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Thermography in Patellar and Achilles Tendon in order to measure changes in temperature os these areas of interest

arm_group.description: 6 Weeks Training with eccentric Overload (Squat with Yoyo Technology) 3 Consecutive Days Running 1 hour at 80% of Maximus Heart Rate
3 Consecutive Days Running 1 hour at 80% of Maximus Heart Rate

intervention.description: 3 Consecutive Days Running at 80% Maximus Heart Rate
Training with Eccentric Overload (Squat in Yoyo Technology) during 6 Weeks 3 Consecutive Days Running at 80% Maximus Heart Rate

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy subjects that performs any sport usually
- Subjects that never have made eccentric training will be included.
- Subjects must be willing to perform the procedure
- Sign informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects enrolled with lower limb pathology in last 6 months
- Subjects that don´t complete all the procedure will be excluded.
